description: Banking Law examines key aspects of the legal regulation of banking in Australia. Topics covered in this lecture include: the current system of banking regulation in Australia the regulation of the "bank-customer" relationship recent banking law reforms after the Global Financial Crisis changes to lending regulation and the National Consumer Credit reforms Australia's new personal property securities law and the Personal Properties Securities Act negotiable instruments and cheques electronic banking.
